ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yeah. I would strongly recommend it, because we would learn much about atmospheric and oceanic dynamics from it.
Yes, definitely. this course should be a must for anyone in G&G.

Recommend after taking GFD class.It is a hard class if one does things appropriately and at the same time it is a very easy class if you skip reading papers and don't spend time to understand material (sadly this happens in most cases).
- Definitely recommend if you've learnt GFD previously.- Recommend a sincere audit in your first year, and a definite recommend in your 2nd year, after taking GFD.

It's a useful class to gain deeper understanding of fundamental geophysical fluid dynamics concepts. The class is six units, two weeks per unit. Each unit covers a concept, including the paper(s) (first week) and a fluid mechanics experiment (second week).It's helpful for any first or second year Atmospheres and Oceans student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned a lot about atmospheric and oceanic dynamics from this course, and it helps me a lot on my own research.
the knowledge gained from seminar is more deep, which is very helpful for research and getting ideas.

- Helped me get started with reading with papers, which I believe is a weakness of mine.- Helps you realize where you stand when it comes to making scientific presentations and talks and tells you areas of improvement.
